content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is creative, it can be solved, and it needs a couple of steps, which makes especially Shortest interesting. I would get stressed to solve this one in Fastest mode, because you do need to take into account quite some variables - but stress is a fair additional challenge.

An excellent puzzle, great fun to solve :)

"menu" -> "meal"

"Bob has hungry and enter into a restaurant to eat." 
-> "Bob is hungry, and goes into a restaurant to eat."

"[[nbDessert]]" -> "[[nbDesserts]]" 

"Bob choose the most expensive complete menu that he can pay." 
-> "Bob wants the most expensive complete meal (1 appetizer, 1 main course, and 1 dessert) that he can buy."

"You have to return the remaining budget of Bob." 
-> "Output Bob's remaining money after buying the meal."

"If Bob doesn't have enough budget for any complete menu, return HUNGRY." 
-> "If Bob doesn't have enough budget for any complete meal, output {{HUNGRY}}."

"[[nbAppetizers]] next lines" -> "Next [[nbAppetizers]] lines"

"[[nbMainCourses]] next lines" -> "Next [[nbMainCourses]] lines"

"[[nbDessert]] next lines" -> "Next [[nbDesserts]] lines"

"the budget of Bob for its lunch"
-> "Bob's budget for his lunch"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's really fun to solve and it is unique in its own way while still adhere to the general style and tone set by this site

Goal section
* Suggest to format HUNGRY as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Input section / cases
* The name and the price of a dish are separated by a comma and a space, instead of just a comma. Please change either the descriptions or the cases.

Thanks.

Update done.
Thanks for your comment.
No problem - I do recommend changing "menu" to "meal" everywhere, as "menu" could mean the complete list of /every/ item.
